data.text:
📢 Calling all photographers! The annual photo competition for the 2022  @WMO  calendar is open for entries.

Submit photos relating to weather, climate, water as well as next year’s #WorldMetDay theme on reducing the risk of disasters. https://t.co/wXQnQ8xcN5 https://t.co/3BJeJKpf8e

Breastfeeding provides babies with the best possible start in life & creates a foundation for a healthy future.

As #WorldBreastfeedingWeek comes to an end, see how the UN family showed support for mums to breastfeed anytime, anywhere. https://t.co/hyd8r6HugM

Happy birthday to our Messenger of Peace @CharlizeAfrica! 

Thank you for your tireless commitment to HIV prevention and the elimination of violence against women. https://t.co/TQouWBQ6CA #GlobalGoals https://t.co/zPJRvbXZF1

UN peacekeepers from Austria serve at great personal risk & in harsh conditions to help others.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/8UsUg40hT9

Mothers shouldn't have to chose between breastfeeding & work. 

Lawmakers can support breastfeeding by ensuring paid maternity leave & preventing discrimination against mothers in the workplace. 

More from @WHO: https://t.co/nVHAwu4ORA #WorldBreastfeedingWeek https://t.co/mZ2hoTUcuM

War in Afghanistan has entered a new, deadlier & more destructive phase, warns the UN's top official in the country, appealing to Security Council to take action to avert catastrophe. https://t.co/hK93wuo4IU

Humanitarian ceasefire needed now, more than ever, in Ethiopia's Tigray region, says @UNReliefChief.

Massive aid operation across frontline underway, as 400,000 people face famine. https://t.co/kX1L3cMKde

One team. One goal. 

Let’s make sure everyone around the world has access to vaccines. #OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic and get back to what we love. https://t.co/LehavVjPgT https://t.co/pPz68qElMr

Lifesaving humanitarian operations in Myanmar hampered by major funding shortfall, warns @WFP.

Spike in #COVID19 infections is compounding hunger as families struggle amid job losses, rising food & fuel prices, political unrest, violence and displacement. https://t.co/HTOylat8Xp

Nearly 760 million people worldwide lack access to electricity. 

Energy services are key to preventing disease & fighting pandemics – from powering healthcare facilities & supplying clean water, to enabling technologies that connect people. https://t.co/6gN3jgSapl #GlobalGoals https://t.co/iabWw5BYU0

It’s #WorldBreastfeedingWeek!  

Breastfeeding prevents hunger & malnutrition and provides health benefits for both mom & baby. 

From fathers to extended family & employers, each of us can do our part to support breastfeeding. https://t.co/qNSdKh6BCL
https://t.co/VtheOkBVvE

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for our future.

The length of droughts, the spread of diseases & more hinge on these few degrees.

Limiting temperature rise is still possible if we #ActNow. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV via @UNFCCC https://t.co/apczD3C4SK

"The only guarantee against the use of nuclear weapons is their total elimination."  

-- @antonioguterres as the world marks 76 years since the Hiroshima atomic bombing. https://t.co/IQQd715npl https://t.co/bAvLTidjG2

We will be together to cheer again - but only when vaccines reach everyone everywhere. 

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic and get back to what we love. https://t.co/LehavV2dSj https://t.co/j5AOGoTCit

“There needs to be an immediate ceasefire to alleviate the suffering of civilians in Daraa.”

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet warns about the plight of civilians in southern Syria, urging the parties to allow & facilitate access for humanitarian relief. https://t.co/9485vtMv0C

The number of refugees who were given shelter in safe host countries plunged last year due to #COVID19 border restrictions, which continue to hamper the resettlement of vulnerable people forced to flee. https://t.co/8VELK37H5j https://t.co/R3vyjW659v

Breastfeeding is not a one-woman job.

Let's support breastfeeding mothers at home, in the workplace, and everywhere.

Spread the word on #WorldBreastfeedingWeek! via @UN_Women https://t.co/FyIuw2GeuI

Austria provides military & police officers to six @UNPeacekeeping missions.

We thank these brave women & men, who have continued their important protection work even amid the challenges posed by #COVID19. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/jpGp7vso2I

From Bangladesh, to Honduras & Nigeria, people who are the least responsible for the climate crisis, share how it has hit them the hardest. 
 
We need urgent #ClimateAction now. 

#TheHumanRace via @UNOCHA
https://t.co/gKIug7L43w

"It was heart-breaking to see the scale of devastation and families who, to this day, do not have a place to live or food to put on their table."

-- @UNReliefChief on visit to Ethiopia's Tigray region, where 90% of the population needs life-saving aid. https://t.co/JANIZGwMIL

It’s #WorldBreastfeedingWeek. 

Breast milk is the ideal first food. It's safe, clean & can protect against illnesses.

Breastfeeding should start within an hour of birth & continue until the child is at least two years old. 

More from @WHO: https://t.co/J8ktM5P90k https://t.co/PA1rWpWu8C

"We have a unique opportunity to renew our commitment & generate essential, immediate financial assistance to the people in Lebanon to prevent a humanitarian catastrophe.”

-- @AminaJMohammed at donor conference marking one year since Beirut blast. https://t.co/npafpbeVzX

From ensuring equitable access to vaccines and training healthcare workers, to donating masks and medical equipment.

See the many ways the UN is working to support communities and countries to overcome the #COVID19 crisis in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/Oj3XRr5jqR

One year after the deadly blasts that rocked Beirut. and following months of economic crisis, @WFP is now supporting one in six people in Lebanon - more than at any time in its history. #ZeroHunger

https://t.co/2wrlaW0XPV https://t.co/CrK4eRubEc

Join #PeterRabbitFoodHero and take #ClimateAction by bringing your own shopping bags, eating more fruits & vegetables and reducing your food waste. 

More tips on how you can #ActNow for our planet and our future: https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y https://t.co/uKHhbF1bvG

Afghanistan: @UNAMAnews urges immediate end to fighting in urban areas as civilians bear the brunt of the violence while Taliban continues ground assault in the south of the country. https://t.co/LoIaV8gMnk

Small island nations across the world are bearing the brunt of the climate crisis, and their problems have been intensified by #COVID19.

Here's a closer look at some of the many challenges these countries face & how they could be overcome. #ClimateAction https://t.co/Vdu2dFwzxW

Now more than ever, healthcare workers & facilities must be protected & respected. They are #NotATarget. 

Since 2017, hundreds of health workers have been killed & injured, while health facilities have been destroyed or closed, according to @WHO. https://t.co/7jCPB5pWQc

Many thanks to @Twitter for activating this year's #WeAreIndigenous emoji ahead of next week's #IndigenousDay!

Use the hashtag to join the conversation & learn more about this year's events. https://t.co/ZlUW4yp0si https://t.co/9XIZTAVTWP

"I want my daughters to have the same opportunities in life that I have had."
 
-- 2016 @F1 World Champion & sustainability entrepreneur @NicoRosberg explains why gender equality and #ClimateAction are important to him. https://t.co/MWhGAd95BR https://t.co/VcKo4gYS5C

The UN remains fully committed to supporting all efforts to achieve accountability and justice for the Yazidis who were brutally targeted by ISIL in northern Iraq seven years ago. https://t.co/Vxl72Afm2A

"The effects of those explosions are still reverberating 1 year later. The country is striving to find a path to emerge from a tragedy that has touched every single person."

-- UN Humanitarian Coordinator for Lebanon @rochdi_najat on Beirut explosions. https://t.co/EXbQrS9hAh

Protecting breastfeeding during the pandemic is a shared responsibility.

Women with #COVID19 can breastfeed if they wish to do so & they must be supported. 

Key facts from @pahowho: https://t.co/dlW5m1EDug https://t.co/sQl09ZeBEd

Sport can foster diversity, tolerance & respect.

As the #Tokyo2020 @Olympics continue, athletes, influencers & innovators share their thoughts on the role that sport can play in helping to achieve the #GlobalGoals & building a better world for all.
https://t.co/xgPsty4xG4

This year, 37 new sites have been inscribed on @UNESCO's World Heritage List.

These sites belong to all of us, and it's our shared responsibility to protect & preserve them for future generations. https://t.co/AyoszEOZEs https://t.co/Fn43wVEmh5

Sport teaches girls how to:
👏 Stand in solidarity
💪 Be resilient & confident
🤼‍♀️ Trust teamwork

#WomenInSport defy gender stereotypes & social norms, make inspiring role models & demonstrate equality. https://t.co/WjijKfI1Il via @UN_Women #Tokyo2020 https://t.co/9MXphbRgPa

Amid extreme weather emergencies around the world, 110 countries have presented new or updated national #ClimateAction plans. 

@UNFCCC chief @PEspinosaC calls on all others to redouble their efforts & honour their commitments of the #ParisAgreement. https://t.co/TCTuMZe4Da https://t.co/2vDwa3saGt

#UNGA establishes new platform to improve lives of people of African descent, who have been suffering from racism & the legacy of enslavement around the world.

The 10-member advisory forum will work closely with the Human Rights Council. https://t.co/ROdvKBcmpu

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for our future.

The risk of wildfires, frequency of disasters & more hinge on these few degrees.

Limiting temperature rise is still possible if we #ActNow. https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y via @UNFCCC https://t.co/5QmMqTsmYP

Myanmar: UN's top aid official in the country expresses concern about the widening impact of the ongoing political, human rights & humanitarian crisis six months after military takeover. https://t.co/VzsjpL3pi5

Men and women have experienced the #COVID19 crisis and suffered its consequences differently.

From employment losses to infection rates and mental health challenges, the @WorldBank has more on the distinct and varied toll of the pandemic. 👇https://t.co/x2Tb3nEVh5

Food assistance can save lives in an emergency, but to achieve #ZeroHunger it is key to improve nutrition for all.

See how Nobel Peace Prize laureate @WFP works to end hunger & malnutrition around the world: https://t.co/1z3Yatp6Hk

https://t.co/yEzjpgAxKj

💰 investment = 💰💰💰💰 benefits

Adapting to the impacts of the climate crisis & investing in early warning systems & climate resilient infrastructure will generate social, environmental & economic benefits. https://t.co/Nvl0LyI1N0 https://t.co/jKkbmZSAeD

UN peacekeepers from Austria are #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping, leaving their families behind to protect the most vulnerable.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/l3KeP1Y873

What are 3 actions your country or community could take to build a greener, more inclusive future? 

If you are 18-35 years old, submit your photo or video with ideas for #OurGreenerFuture to the @WorldBank: https://t.co/vE6uKsYOuO https://t.co/frhXj8OJkv

In this time of crisis, there is no room for food loss and waste!

From apps to maximise food donations to 3D product designs, @FAO has more about innovative technologies that are transforming our food systems for the better. https://t.co/kOfU2kW8ng

Globally, 20% of girls under the age of 15 are growing up in extreme poverty -- a situation worsened by the #COVID19 crisis. 

@UN_Women is working to protect the well-being & future of women & girls everywhere. https://t.co/9DkJpsP6x9 https://t.co/H5KUlkCPEh

🚴‍♀️ Biking to work
💡 Switching off the lights
👖 Buying sustainable fashion

Taking #ClimateAction & living more sustainably doesn't have to be difficult.

The #ActNow app helps you reduce your carbon footprint - and have fun doing it: https://t.co/4i2kqgYQPL https://t.co/Ay8ZqVX8u6

#VaccinesWork, are safe and help prevent millions of deaths every year. 

Yet, anti-vaccine messages stir up fear about vaccination, ignoring the serious risks posed by preventable illnesses. https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/8mGikt5mKb

With many children still out of school due to the #COVID19 pandemic, the future of an entire generation is at stake.

@UNICEF, @UNESCO & @WorldBank have joined forces to support countries in reopening schools & recovering lost learning. https://t.co/iLSo9zR00T

India assumes the rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of August. 

Follow @IndiaUNNewYork for updates. https://t.co/mbjVlQDeEL https://t.co/CMvIPJMwQK

By 2050, there could be more plastic than fish in the ocean. The time to #BeatPlasticPollution is NOW.

The incredible images from around the world featured in this inspiring exhibit show how #PlasticIsForever: https://t.co/nPGl2lw8yU https://t.co/dcyrKB0aIo

People become refugees not by choice, but forced by circumstances.

Resettlement in another country is a life-saving option available for only the most vulnerable among them. 

More from @Refugees: https://t.co/bwtASJ14eR https://t.co/7jRxyLsHyS

Peter Rabbit is doing his part to protect our planet & he is asking YOU to become a food hero like him.

From growing your own fruits & vegetables to composting & wasting less food, all of us can take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y #PeterRabbitFoodHero https://t.co/mdFTixE0gY

The @Tokyo2020 Olympics will have close to equal representation of women & men athletes for the first time in the history of the games.

Sport is one of the great drivers of gender equality. via @UN_Women https://t.co/PvMF5DkVPR

UN peacekeepers from Guatemala serve at great personal risk & in harsh conditions to help others.

We thank these brave women & men for #ServingForPeace, including amid the challenges caused by #COVID19. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/AIVvBdxiv7

Healthy ecosystems can absorb carbon emissions and help limit global temperature rise. 

The Decade on Ecosystem Restoration is a rallying call for the protection & revival of ecosystems around the world. 

Join #GenerationRestoration: https://t.co/hzVHbYZkQ3 https://t.co/8LzrTEViXz

Libya: Mercenaries are impeding progress toward peace and are an obstacle to upcoming elections, warn independent @UNHumanRights experts, calling for their departure from the conflict-affected country. https://t.co/pq4ZfU2rEh

When it comes to #COVID19, no one is safe until everyone is safe. 

Get inspired by examples of solidarity & kindness amid the pandemic in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/8xa6sPOT6e

.@UNCDF makes finance work for people in need in the world's 46 least developed countries (LDCs), helping them achieve the #GlobalGoals.

Find out more on Friday's first-ever #LDCsDay: https://t.co/BBC8cAyzRj https://t.co/DW69L23bAo

Friday is #FriendshipDay! 🤗

Friendship between peoples, countries, cultures, and individuals can inspire peace and build bridges between communities. https://t.co/ouxkRQrK6z https://t.co/ZhAq066h1z

Human trafficking happens around us, every day, & criminals are using increasingly sophisticated methods, including social media.

On Friday's #EndHumanTrafficking Day, find out what @UNODC is doing to stop this crime & how you can help: https://t.co/7DtrQrF4FE https://t.co/MO9vQJAgKo

Friends don't let friends share misinformation.

On Friday's #FriendshipDay and every day -- #PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts before sharing information online. https://t.co/fBGWhntIrq https://t.co/FQ1i4WntO6

"The UN is committed to listening and responding to the voices of victims and survivors of human trafficking."

-- @antonioguterres on Friday's #EndHumanTrafficking Day. https://t.co/9qWeNMccXF https://t.co/lqBpaScgoC

The #COVID19 crisis has led to an increase in the killing of people with albinism. The majority of victims have been children. 

The road ahead in the fight against these heinous acts remains long and arduous, an independent @UNHumanRights expert says. https://t.co/XI1de4m8q7

Survivors play a key role in the fight against human trafficking. We must learn from their experience & listen to their advice.

More from @UNODC on Friday's #EndHumanTrafficking Day: https://t.co/BjxS7pkjdA https://t.co/hJ0Amu4XFS

Friends can be a lifeline and a source of strength to help us through tough times, such as the #COVID19 crisis. 

On Friday's #FriendshipDay, connect with your friends & let them know you appreciate them! https://t.co/ouxkRQJkY7

🎨: Leyah Mirza https://t.co/kxnFZeyeg1

Yemen: New funding from the @WorldBank will help fight the spread of extreme hunger in the country and provide rural families with opportunities to build sustainable food security. 
https://t.co/esDDwyCtsE

Tips for good mental health:

🏋🏽 Exercise regularly
🥗 Eat healthy
😴 Get enough sleep
🍺 Limit alcohol intake
🗣 Talk about your feelings

More resources from @WHO: https://t.co/OnDy1sVm7E https://t.co/bJWtAZ871r

As of Thursday, the world has already used up more resources than can be renewed this year. 

Each and every one of us needs to #ActNow to ensure sustainable consumption & production to protect our planet. https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo #EarthOverShootDay https://t.co/mnXWgAcpAZ

With only 3,500 wild tigers left in the 🌏, these beautiful creatures, threatened by habitat loss & wildlife trafficking, need your help. 

On #InternationalTigerDay, go #WildForLife and find out what you can do to protect them: https://t.co/JYaFYdQQpt https://t.co/OQPS3pBSow

💰 investment = 💰💰💰💰 benefits

Adapting to the impacts of the climate crisis & investing in early warning systems, resilient water resources & other climate resilient infrastructure will generate social, environmental & economic benefits. https://t.co/MWhGAcRudh https://t.co/CoA7WCoEK2

Bangladesh: Deadly flooding & landslides caused by heavy monsoon rain have wreaked havoc & destruction in Rohingya refugee camps in Cox's Bazar.

@Refugees is supporting Government-led response to provide immediate support for affected families. https://t.co/REwUVbZ8K1

Over the last century, the global tiger population has declined by 95% due to habitat loss & wildlife trafficking. Today, there are more tigers in captivity than in the wild.

On Thursday's #InternationalTigerDay, see how @UNEP works to help protect tigers https://t.co/5L0lZJoWL3 https://t.co/T0Vdk8HZCn

Every year, hundreds of thousand of people in Afghanistan are forced to flee their homes, leaving many with extreme physical & psychological harm.

@UNOCHA highlights 9 facts about the human toll of violence in the country. https://t.co/DaHm7l4kQ6

"Food is, quite simply, a transformative agent of change."

-- @AminaJMohammed as leaders explore solutions for creating inclusive food systems that protect human health, help achieve the #GlobalGoals & safeguard the planet's future. https://t.co/tPqgoddzt6 https://t.co/nTC7avDoec

“Urgent efforts to improve the situation in Gaza must move forward swiftly, but let us not lose sight of the broader goal: resolving the Israeli-Palestinian conflict."

-- UN Deputy Special Coordinator for the Middle East in briefing to Security Council. https://t.co/LJTAKEOEQ4

Anxiety, violence & teenage pregnancy all on the rise amid widespread school closures due to #COVID19.

With remote learning out of reach for many children, @UNICEF is stressing the need for schools to safely reopen as soon as possible. https://t.co/EQiuGrF6nz

For 70 years, the Refugee Convention has been protecting people forced to flee.

With war, conflict & persecution displacing 82 million people globally, recommitting to the Convention's spirit & fundamental principles is as urgent as ever. via @Refugees https://t.co/kENZcikbAe

🚴‍♀️ Biking to work
💡 Switching off the lights
👖 Buying sustainable fashion

People around the world have logged more than 3 million of their #ClimateAction activities. 

Join the movement & download the app that helps you #ActNow to protect our planet. https://t.co/4i2kqgHfrb https://t.co/2n4kCKfCVN

Guatemala provides military & police officers to seven @UNPeacekeeping missions.

We thank these brave women & men for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/WHokhfKjPm

Every 30 seconds a person dies from a hepatitis related illness.

On Wednesday's #WorldHepatitisDay, see how @WHO is working towards eliminating viral hepatitis as a public health threat by 2030: https://t.co/OzUjLkyV3p https://t.co/Y59ff2RmBr

During times of high-stress, it is completely normal to feel anxious, isolated or overwhelmed. It's important to look after yourself.

🏃🏽‍♀️🥗 Stay active & eat well
📲 Stay in contact with friends & family 
🤗 Be kind to yourself & others

🎨: @UN_Women https://t.co/VgzQg0PEqV
Myanmar: Independent @UNHumanRights expert calls for a 'COVID ceasefire' in the country as infections & deaths soar amid escalating attacks against healthcare workers. https://t.co/hcnnEgtrGW

Almost 90% of people living with viral hepatitis are unaware they have it.

On Wednesday's #WorldHepatitisDay, @WHO is calling on countries to expand timely testing & treatment to save lives. https://t.co/OzUjLkhjEP https://t.co/BcGZJKUwMD

"It is a shame that we have one single child going to bed hungry – let alone dying of hunger at a rate of one every five, six seconds."

-- @WFPChief at @FoodSystems Pre-Summit in Rome. #ZeroHunger https://t.co/xRTLzZFFGi https://t.co/Gswa7n4IHV

Nearly 2 million people have been displaced by the ongoing conflict in Ethiopia's Tigray region. 

Many of them are children, who are facing grave harm amid this humanitarian crisis. Here's how @UNmigration is providing mental health support for them: https://t.co/rKfTLaM9I2 https://t.co/MT2jd83Qbp

At the #Tokyo2020 @Olympics, almost 49% of the athletes will be women, making it the most gender-balanced games in history & a powerful means of empowering women & girls.

Meet some of these inspiring #WomenInSport. via @UN_Women https://t.co/UVlnAkrhGK

.@UNVolunteers can make a positive impact on people's lives and help achieve the #GlobalGoals.

Learn more about how you can join them and make a difference: https://t.co/zZkAeWx8JP https://t.co/t8yumW3bJv

"We need to stop denying racism & start dismantling it. 

We need to end impunity, confront past legacies & deliver redress. 

We need to listen to the voices of people of African descent & be worthy of their trust."

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet. https://t.co/eRnoKvFw7L https://t.co/MJSjMa7fJv

Afghanistan: Record number of women & children killed or injured in conflict during first half of 2021. 

With a 47% increase in civilian casualties compared to same period last year, @UNAMAnews warns many more lives will be lost if violence isn't stopped. https://t.co/haNZyjR146

Amid exceptional weather events globally, delegates begin discussions on key report examining scientific basis of climate change.

@IPCC_CH study will provide latest information on warming projections, detail human influence on climate & more. https://t.co/L99eObCOAO

The number of people forced to flee their homes due to conflict, war, human rights abuses & other dangers has reached record-breaking proportions.
Many of them come from just a handful of countries. @Refugees has details. ⬇️ https://t.co/XiWUtNmuDE

https://t.co/R4uGLa6eOI

UN peacekeepers from Guatemala are #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping, leaving their families behind to protect the most vulnerable.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/L1o0PKTpnD

The UN Food Systems Pre-Summit gets underway in Rome on Monday. 

World leaders, civil society, producers, indigenous peoples & others are coming together to explore bold actions needed to transform the future of food. 

Follow @FoodSystems for more. https://t.co/hj0M1rXnWr https://t.co/QsFC1Fj3p7

Mangroves are rare ecosystems on the boundary between land & sea. 

On Monday's #MangroveDay, see how mangroves can help address the climate crisis: https://t.co/u8d81li13t via @UNESCO https://t.co/Xsx69Q8AH7
